node.title: CCTV vital as Cleo Smith investigators shift focus to movements of her alleged abductor
node.alt: A tight head shot of a heavily pixelated man's face.
node.description: As the investigation into the disappearance of Cleo Smith enters its third week, officers will be turning their attention to the activity of the man accused of taking her.Â
node.content:
["As the investigation into the disappearance of Cleo Smith enters its third week, officers will be turning their attention to the man accused of taking her.", "It has been revealed Terence Darrell Kelly has links to a social media account that posts about loving dolls, and where he claims to have a partner and five children, despite living alone.\u00a0", "He appeared in Carnarvon Magistrate's Court yesterday afternoon, charged with one count of forcibly taking a child under 16 and one other charge.", "He was barefoot, wore a black shirt and had his hair out.", "Mr Kelly was charged and faced court after he was\u00a0taken to hospital twice while in custody following his arrest.", "", "
Terence Kelly was twice taken to hospital while in police custody after his arrest.(Supplied: Channel 7)
", "Mr Kelly is being transferred to a prison in Perth today.", "A charter flight left Carnarvon at about 11.30am local time with Mr Kelly onboard, accompanied by four special operations group corrections officers.", "He is being taken to a maximum-security prison in Perth to await his next court appearance in about four weeks time.", "
Expanded CCTV search underway
", "A key focus of the investigation will now be tracking Mr Kelly's movements in the days before Cleo was found inside a housing commission home in Carnarvon.", "Police have so far revealed little of what they know about what happened in the 18 days between the four-year-old vanishing from her parents' tent at the Blowholes campground, and her being found at the home.", "", "
Cleo Smith was found in a locked house in the Brockman area of Carnarvon on Tuesday night.(ABC News)
", "The man leading the investigation, Detective Superintendent Rod Wilde, said police were not sure if Cleo had been in the home for all 18 days.", "Before Cleo was found, police had called for people to supply CCTV footage from a variety of locations across the state, including bakeries and children's clothing stores.", "As part of this new stage of the investigation, police are now asking for all CCTV footage people can provide from across the town in WA's Gascoyne region.", "", "
Police want\u00a0anyone in Carnarvon with\u00a0CCTV footage from recent weeks to provide it.(ABC News: Evelyn Manfield)
", "\"Now that we have knowledge of a suspect, I'm asking businesses and people within Carnarvon to provide to the investigative team any CCTV that they might have between Friday the 15th and Tuesday the 2nd,\" Detective Senior Sergeant Cameron Blaine said yesterday.", "That stretches from the day before Cleo disappeared to the day before she was found.", "
Footage appears to show arrest
", "Dash camera footage has also been released, purporting to show the moment Mr Kelly was arrested.", "It was only shortly before officers forced their way into the Carnavon home and found Cleo awake and playing with toys.", "The grainy footage, which appears to have been captured in the minutes before midnight on Tuesday, shows a car pinned between two other cars on the side of the road.", "", "
Dashcam footage purports to show the moment Terence Kelly was arrested.(Supplied)
", "It was the culmination of the police investigation that came to a head only hours after Mr Kelly was identified as a suspect.", "\"Trying to gather further information, things became a little clearer, we had identified that this person was a person of interest,\" Superintendent Wilde said yesterday.", "Senior Sergeant Blaine said police quickly formulated a number of plans about what could happen.", "", "
Detective Senior Sergeant Cameron Blaine (second from right) with the other detectives who\u00a0found Cleo.(ABC News)
", "\"One of them was that the suspect that we were observing could be mobile and would leave the premises,\" he said.", "\"In terms of decisions, it wasn't that hard.", "\"What happened was one of those scenarios, and it was clear in my head what had to occur, so it was just 'OK, let's do that'.\"", "Police have said they cannot say why the man left his home at that time of night."]
